item.title: 并非人人都在享受无着陆经济
item.description: 美国经济不景气？实际上，如果你看一下最新的民意调查，大多数美国人感觉自己的经济状况比四年前大流行病最严重的时候更糟。虽然党派之争和通货膨胀挥之不去的影响肯定与此有关，但现实情况是，美国经济在富人和穷人之间存在着明显的鸿沟。【原文：No-landing US economy? Well actually, if you look at the latest polls, the majority of Americans feel worse off than they did four years ago at the height of the pandemic. And while partisanship and the lingering effects of inflation certainly have a lot to do with it, the reality is that there’s a stark divide in the US economy between haves and have-nots.】

item.title: BMO 表示，IPO 的复兴可能在 2025 年推动 500 亿美元的新交易
item.description: 蒙特利尔银行资本市场（BMO Capital Markets）的资深银行家表示，明年美国首次公开募股市场有望加速发展，有可能将此类交易量推向四年来的新高。【原文：The market for US initial public offerings is expected to accelerate next year, according to senior bankers at BMO Capital Markets, potentially pushing the volume of such deals to a four-year high.】

item.title: 受托人称 Synapse 冻结的资金将在年底前归还
item.description: 据法院指定受托人 Jelena McWilliams 称，在银行即服务提供商 Synapse Financial Technologies Inc. 破产期间被冻结的约 2 亿美元消费者资金的剩余部分应于 12 月返还给客户。【原文：The remainder of the roughly $200 million of consumer funds frozen during the bankruptcy of banking-as-a-service provider Synapse Financial Technologies Inc. should be returned to customers in December, according to court-appointed trustee Jelena McWilliams.】

item.title: 瑞波公司首席执行官布拉德-加林豪斯称 XRP ETF "不可避免
item.description: 在与美国证券交易委员会（US Securities and Exchange Commission）就证券的构成问题陷入长达数年的争论之后，瑞波实验室公司（Ripple Labs Inc.首席执行官布拉德-加林豪斯（Brad Garlinghouse）表示，该公司的 XRP 加密货币将通过交易所交易基金发售，这是 "不可避免的"。【原文：After being embroiled in a years-long dispute with the US Securities and Exchange Commission over what constitutes a security, Ripple Labs Inc. Chief Executive Officer Brad Garlinghouse says it’s “just inevitable” that the company’s XRP cryptocurrency will be offered through an exchange-traded fund.】

item.title: 苹果在 M4 MacBook Air 上取得进展并计划推出新款低端 iPad
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，苹果公司即将生产采用 M4 芯片的更新版 MacBook Air，将于 2025 年初发布，这是下一周即将推出的新款 Mac 的后续产品。【原文：Apple Inc. is nearing production of updated MacBook Airs with M4 chips for release in early 2025, a follow-up to a wave of new Macs that are coming next week, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 大选和美联储助推美元创两年来最佳月度走势
item.description: 随着交易商对美联储的预期进行重新定价，并为有可能颠覆宏观市场的总统大选做准备，美元有望在本月创下自 2022 年以来的最佳汇率。【原文：The dollar is on pace for its best month since 2022 as traders reprice Federal Reserve expectations and prepare for a presidential election that threatens to upend macro markets.】

item.title: 乌克兰残疾津贴丑闻引发新的贪污担忧
item.description: 乌克兰破获了一起涉及检察官和医疗委员会成员的非法骗取伤残补助金的阴谋，这是这个饱受战争蹂躏的国家最近发生的一起腐败丑闻。【原文：Ukraine has uncovered an illicit scheme to obtain disability benefits involving prosecutors and members of medical commissions, in the latest corruption scandal to hit the war-torn nation.】

item.title: 国债 "期限溢价 "飙升警示债券风险上升
item.description: 美国国债市场已经陷入今年以来最严重的亏损之一，随着收益率飙升，市场又发出了新的风险加剧的警告信号。【原文：The US Treasury market, already mired in one of its worst losing stretches of the year, is flashing a fresh warning sign of mounting risks as yields surge.】

item.title: 杰富瑞、Truist 因竞争激烈的小额债券交易而大涨
item.description: 杰富瑞金融集团公司（Jefferies Financial Group Inc.【原文：Jefferies Financial Group Inc. and Truist Financial Corp. are winning a larger number of muni bond sales up for auction this year, the latest evidence of the shake up in the market after large banks like Citigroup Inc. pulled back.】

item.title: 二叠纪生产商斗牛士公司上调 2024 年石油生产计划
item.description: 斗牛士资源公司（Matador Resources Co.）计划在2024年生产比先前计划更多的石油，这预示着美国最繁忙的油田--二叠纪盆地（Permian Basin）西部的油井将继续引领全国石油增长。【原文：Matador Resources Co. plans to produce more oil in 2024 than previously planned, a signal that wells in the western part of the Permian Basin — the busiest US oil field — continue to lead national oil growth.】

item.title: 尼日利亚蒂努布在首次内阁调整中解雇五名部长
item.description: 尼日利亚总统博拉-蒂努布（Bola Tinubu）宣布对内阁进行大调整，解除了五位部长的职务，这是他自2023年5月就职以来的首次内阁调整。【原文：Nigerian President Bola Tinubu announced an overhaul of his cabinet, relieving five ministers of their positions in the first such shakeup since he took office in May 2023.】

item.title: 加拿大输油管道改变流向，拉美石油找到新买家
item.description: 由于加拿大最近扩建的跨山管道改变了全球石油流向，美国墨西哥湾沿岸的炼油厂正越来越多地转向拉美重质原油。【原文：Refiners on the US Gulf Coast are increasingly turning to Latin American heavy crude as Canada’s recently expanded Trans Mountain pipeline reroutes global oil flows.】

item.title: 拉加德称美国大选获胜者应谨防损害贸易
item.description: 克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，无论谁赢得美国大选，都应谨防损害全球贸易，再次为自由贸易的益处辩护。【原文：Christine Lagarde said that whoever wins the US election should beware of hurting global trade, in a renewed defense of the benefits of free commerce.】

item.title: 货币交易员为美国大选后的墨西哥比索大戏做好准备
item.description: 在不到两周的美国大选之后，墨西哥贸易商正为比索的剧烈波动做好准备，胜负将在卡马拉-哈里斯和唐纳德-特朗普之间掷硬币决定。【原文：Mexico traders are bracing for violent swings in the peso after the US election in less than two weeks, with the winner a coin toss between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.】

item.title: 经济学家和投资者对加拿大央行降息的看法
item.description: 加拿大央行周三将隔夜利率降至 3.75%，这是自 2022 年 12 月以来的最低水平。以下是经济学家和投资者对此的看法。【原文：The Bank of Canada cut its overnight rate to 3.75% on Wednesday, its lowest level since December 2022. Here’s what economists and investors are saying about it.】

item.title: 微软称俄罗斯用 "假视频 "抹黑卡玛拉-哈里斯
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp）的最新研究显示，俄罗斯巨魔正在利用人工智能，包括深度伪造副总统卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris），试图在美国大选前影响公众舆论。【原文：Russian trolls are using artificial intelligence, including a deepfake of Vice President Kamala Harris, to try influencing public opinion ahead the US election, according to new research from Microsoft Corp.】

item.title: 高管称加快行动是能源转型的关键
item.description: 在圣保罗举行的 B20 峰会上，彭博新经济公司的高管们表示，向更可持续的世界过渡的最大挑战是找到一种方法来扩大和加快跨边界和跨行业的行动。【原文：The biggest challenge in the transition to a more sustainable world is finding a way to scale up and speed up actions across borders and industries, according to executives at Bloomberg New Economy at B20 in Sao Paulo.】

item.title: 债券大师马蒂-弗里德森认为收益追逐者将为浮躁的高收益债务买单
item.description: 垃圾债券大师马蒂-弗里德森（Marty Fridson）警告说，追逐美国企业债高收益的投资者并没有得到适当的风险补偿。【原文：Investors chasing fat yields in US corporate debt aren’t being properly compensated for the risks, warns junk bond guru Marty Fridson.】

item.title: 纳格尔告诉 CNBC：欧洲央行在利率问题上保持完全灵活
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，在下一步利率行动方面，官员们保持开放态度，拒绝猜测未来是否有必要进行更大幅度的降息。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Joachim Nagel said officials are keeping all their options open when it comes to the next interest-rate moves, declining to speculate whether a bigger cut may be necessary in the future.】

item.title: 微软正努力挽留女性和少数族裔员工
item.description:

item.title: 软银支持的 Wayve 开始在旧金山进行人工智能试驾
item.description: Wayve Technologies Ltd. 是一家英国初创公司，今年从软银集团为首的投资者那里融资超过 10 亿美元。【原文：Wayve Technologies Ltd., the UK startup that raised more than $1 billion this year from investors led by SoftBank Group, is joining the bevy of companies testing out automated driving in and around Silicon Valley.】

item.title: 德国林德纳敦促欧盟取消内燃机淘汰日期
item.description: 德国财政部长克里斯蒂安-林德纳（Christian Lindner）敦促欧盟放弃在短短十几年内有效淘汰内燃机的目标。【原文：German Finance Minister Christian Lindner urged the European Union to abandon its goal of effectively phasing out the combustion engine in just over a decade.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长莱恩称欧元区通货紧缩进展顺利
item.description: 欧洲中央银行首席经济学家菲利普-莱恩表示，欧元区的通货紧缩正在取得进展。【原文：Disinflation in the euro area is making progress, according to European Central Bank Chief Economist Philip Lane.】

item.title: 拉加德称欧洲央行迄今在通胀问题上取得了 "非常好的进展
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，欧洲央行对通胀率放缓至低于官员们设定的 2% 的目标 "相当满意"。【原文：President Christine Lagarde said the European Central Bank is “rather satisfied” with how inflation has slowed to below the 2% goal targeted by officials.】

item.title: 高盛、苹果在 CFPB 卡调查后将支付 8900 万美元
item.description: 美国最高消费者监督机构周三宣布，在对高盛集团和苹果公司的信用卡合资企业进行长期调查后，高盛集团和苹果公司将支付 8,900 多万美元。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and Apple Inc. will pay more than $89 million following a long-running investigation of their credit-card joint venture, the top consumer watchdog announced Wednesday.】

item.title: 会议记录显示，印度利率制定者仍对通货膨胀感到担忧
item.description: 印度央行货币政策委员会周三的会议纪要显示，由于地缘政治紧张局势和食品价格波动带来的风险仍然挥之不去，印度的利率制定者对通货膨胀保持警惕。【原文：India’s rate-setters remain vigilant on inflation as risks from geopolitical tensions and volatile food prices continue to linger, minutes of the central bank’s monetary policy committee meeting showed Wednesday.】

item.title: 德国林德纳警告特朗普不要挑起与欧盟的贸易战
item.description: 德国财政部长克里斯蒂安-林德纳（Christian Lindner）警告唐纳德-特朗普，如果他重返白宫，不要与欧盟挑起贸易战，因为征收关税会伤害双方。【原文：German Finance Minister Christian Lindner warned Donald Trump against starting a trade war with the European Union if he returns to the White House because imposing tariffs would hurt both sides.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）总裁加斯帕尔表示：美国必须立即行动，改变债务上升的趋势
item.description: 国际货币基金组织官员加斯帕尔（Vitor Gaspar）说，美国不断增加借贷的速度不可能无限期地持续下去，美国应该利用当前的经济形势来解决这个问题。【原文：The US keeps increasing its borrowings at a pace that can’t go on indefinitely and should take advantage of its current economic situation to fix that, International Monetary Fund official Vitor Gaspar said.】
